channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Learning Versatile Skills with Curriculum Masking
item.description: Motivated by how humans learn by organizing knowledge in a curriculum, CurrMask adjusts its masking scheme during pretraining for learning versatile skills.

item.title: DREB-Net: Dual-stream Restoration Embedding Blur-feature Fusion Network for High-mobility UAV Object Detection
item.description: First, DREB-Net addresses the particularities of blurry image object detection problem by incorporating a Blurry image Restoration Auxiliary Branch (BRAB) during the training phase.

item.title: Cross-model Control: Improving Multiple Large Language Models in One-time Training
item.description: Based on this insight, we incorporate a tiny language model with a minimal number of parameters.

item.title: LEADS: Lightweight Embedded Assisted Driving System
item.description: With the rapid development of electric vehicles, formula races that face high school and university students have become more popular than ever as the threshold for design and manufacturing has been lowered.

item.title: MIA-DPO: Multi-Image Augmented Direct Preference Optimization For Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Existing visual alignment methods, primarily designed for single-image scenarios, struggle to effectively handle the complexity of multi-image tasks due to the scarcity of diverse training data and the high cost of annotating chosen/rejected pairs.

item.title: Att2CPC: Attention-Guided Lossy Attribute Compression of Point Clouds
item.description: In this paper, we focus on the task of learned lossy point cloud attribute compression (PCAC).

item.title: ADEM-VL: Adaptive and Embedded Fusion for Efficient Vision-Language Tuning
item.description: To bridge this gap, we propose ADEM-VL, an efficient vision-language method that tunes VL models based on pretrained large language models (LLMs) by adopting a parameter-free cross-attention mechanism for similarity measurements in multimodal fusion.

item.title: Federated Transformer: Multi-Party Vertical Federated Learning on Practical Fuzzily Linked Data
item.description: To overcome these limitations, we introduce the Federated Transformer (FeT), a novel framework that supports multi-party VFL with fuzzy identifiers.

item.title: ESpeW: Robust Copyright Protection for LLM-based EaaS via Embedding-Specific Watermark
item.description: Embeddings as a Service (EaaS) is emerging as a crucial role in AI applications.

item.title: DisenGCD: A Meta Multigraph-assisted Disentangled Graph Learning Framework for Cognitive Diagnosis
item.description: To tackle the issues, this paper suggests a meta multigraph-assisted disentangled graph learning framework for CD (DisenGCD), which learns three types of representations on three disentangled graphs: student-exercise-concept interaction, exercise-concept relation, and concept dependency graphs, respectively.

item.title: Robust Two-View Geometry Estimation with Implicit Differentiation
item.description: We present a novel two-view geometry estimation framework which is based on a differentiable robust loss function fitting.

item.title: Understanding When Tree of Thoughts Succeeds: Larger Models Excel in Generation, Not Discrimination
item.description: In this paper, we analyze the roles of the generator and discriminator separately to better understand the conditions when ToT is beneficial.

item.title: Blendify -- Python rendering framework for Blender
item.description: With the rapid growth of the volume of research fields like computer vision and computer graphics, researchers require effective and user-friendly rendering tools to visualize results.

item.title: Bridging the Gaps: Utilizing Unlabeled Face Recognition Datasets to Boost Semi-Supervised Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: In addition, to further alleviate the scarcity of labeled and diverse images, we propose a Mixup-based data augmentation strategy tailored for facial images, and the loss weights of real and virtual images are determined according to the intersection-over-union (IoU) of the faces in the two images.

item.title: Diffusion Priors for Variational Likelihood Estimation and Image Denoising
item.description: In this paper, we build upon diffusion priors and propose adaptive likelihood estimation and MAP inference during the reverse diffusion process to tackle real-world noise.

item.title: HCDN: A Change Detection Network for Construction Housekeeping Using Feature Fusion and Large Vision Models
item.description: Despite poor housekeeping is a significant contributor to construction accidents, there remains a significant lack of technological research focused on improving housekeeping practices in construction sites.

item.title: Scaling Diffusion Language Models via Adaptation from Autoregressive Models
item.description: Diffusion Language Models (DLMs) have emerged as a promising new paradigm for text generative modeling, potentially addressing limitations of autoregressive (AR) models.

item.title: An Adaptive Framework for Generating Systematic Explanatory Answer in Online Q&A Platforms
item.description: The naive RAG models, although effective in information retrieval, struggle with complex questions that require comprehensive and in-depth answers.

item.title: FairDgcl: Fairness-aware Recommendation with Dynamic Graph Contrastive Learning
item.description: Specifically, we propose FairDgcl, a dynamic graph adversarial contrastive learning framework aiming at improving fairness in recommender system.

item.title: GraphTeam: Facilitating Large Language Model-based Graph Analysis via Multi-Agent Collaboration
item.description: Graphs are widely used for modeling relational data in real-world scenarios, such as social networks and urban computing.

item.title: GenUDC: High Quality 3D Mesh Generation with Unsigned Dual Contouring Representation
item.description: Generating high-quality meshes with complex structures and realistic surfaces is the primary goal of 3D generative models.

item.title: Benchmarking Foundation Models on Exceptional Cases: Dataset Creation and Validation
item.description: Foundation models (FMs) have achieved significant success across various tasks, leading to research on benchmarks for reasoning abilities.

item.title: ALTA: Compiler-Based Analysis of Transformers
item.description: We propose a new programming language called ALTA and a compiler that can map ALTA programs to Transformer weights.

item.title: Scalable Random Feature Latent Variable Models
item.description: To address these issues, we introduce a stick-breaking construction for DP to obtain an explicit PDF and a novel VBI algorithm called ``block coordinate descent variational inference" (BCD-VI).

item.title: Towards Effective Data-Free Knowledge Distillation via Diverse Diffusion Augmentation
item.description: Data-free knowledge distillation (DFKD) has emerged as a pivotal technique in the domain of model compression, substantially reducing the dependency on the original training data.

item.title: Mapping the Media Landscape: Predicting Factual Reporting and Political Bias Through Web Interactions
item.description: Our experiments, targeting two challenging bias descriptors, factual reporting and political bias, showed a significant performance improvement at the source media level.

item.title: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation for Action Recognition via Self-Ensembling and Conditional Embedding Alignment
item.description: To address these challenges, we propose $\mu$DAR, a novel joint optimization architecture comprised of three functions: (i) consistency regularizer between augmented samples to improve model classification generalizability, (ii) temporal ensemble for robust pseudo-label generation and (iii) conditional distribution alignment to improve domain generalizability.

item.title: Bilateral Hippocampi Segmentation in Low Field MRIs Using Mutual Feature Learning via Dual-Views
item.description: Accurate hippocampus segmentation in brain MRI is critical for studying cognitive and memory functions and diagnosing neurodevelopmental disorders.

item.title: Leveraging Deep Learning for Time Series Extrinsic Regression in predicting photometric metallicity of Fundamental-mode RR Lyrae Stars
item.description: Our work underscores the importance of deep learning in astronomical research, particularly with large datasets from missions like Gaia.

item.title: Beyond Backpropagation: Optimization with Multi-Tangent Forward Gradients
item.description: Forward gradients are an approach to approximate the gradients from directional derivatives along random tangents computed by forward-mode automatic differentiation.

item.title: R-CoT: Reverse Chain-of-Thought Problem Generation for Geometric Reasoning in Large Multimodal Models
item.description: Current geometric data generation approaches, which apply preset templates to generate geometric data or use Large Language Models (LLMs) to rephrase questions and answers (Q&A), unavoidably limit data accuracy and diversity.

item.title: OVT-B: A New Large-Scale Benchmark for Open-Vocabulary Multi-Object Tracking
item.description: However, open-vocabulary object tracking (OVT) from a video has been studied less, and one reason is the shortage of benchmarks.

item.title: LongRAG: A Dual-Perspective Retrieval-Augmented Generation Paradigm for Long-Context Question Answering
item.description: To this end, we propose LongRAG, a general, dual-perspective, and robust LLM-based RAG system paradigm for LCQA to enhance RAG's understanding of complex long-context knowledge (i. e., global information and factual details).

item.title: PlantCamo: Plant Camouflage Detection
item.description: Due to the unique characteristics of plant camouflage, including holes and irregular borders, we developed a new framework, named PCNet, dedicated to PCD.

item.title: IdenBAT: Disentangled Representation Learning for Identity-Preserved Brain Age Transformation
item.description: Brain age transformation aims to convert reference brain images into synthesized images that accurately reflect the age-specific features of a target age group.

item.title: Exploring Possibilities of AI-Powered Legal Assistance in Bangladesh through Large Language Modeling
item.description: This research seeks to develop a specialized Large Language Model (LLM) to assist in the Bangladeshi legal system.

item.title: Joint Point Cloud Upsampling and Cleaning with Octree-based CNNs
item.description: Recovering dense and uniformly distributed point clouds from sparse or noisy data remains a significant challenge.

item.title: ISImed: A Framework for Self-Supervised Learning using Intrinsic Spatial Information in Medical Images
item.description: This paper demonstrates that spatial information can be used to learn interpretable representations in medical images using Self-Supervised Learning (SSL).

item.title: Correct after Answer: Enhancing Multi-Span Question Answering with Post-Processing Method
item.description: Multi-Span Question Answering (MSQA) requires models to extract one or multiple answer spans from a given context to answer a question.

item.title: SELA: Tree-Search Enhanced LLM Agents for Automated Machine Learning
item.description: Automated Machine Learning (AutoML) approaches encompass traditional methods that optimize fixed pipelines for model selection and ensembling, as well as newer LLM-based frameworks that autonomously build pipelines.

item.title: AMUSD: Asynchronous Multi-Device Speculative Decoding for LLM Acceleration
item.description: In this work, we introduce AMUSD (Asynchronous Multi-device Speculative Decoding), a system that further accelerates generation by decoupling the draft and verify phases into a continuous, asynchronous approach.

item.title: Hybrid Generative AI for De Novo Design of Co-Crystals with Enhanced Tabletability
item.description: Co-crystallization is an accessible way to control physicochemical characteristics of organic crystals, which finds many biomedical applications.

item.title: Data-driven Coreference-based Ontology Building
item.description: While coreference resolution is traditionally used as a component in individual document understanding, in this work we take a more global view and explore what can we learn about a domain from the set of all document-level coreference relations that are present in a large corpus.

item.title: LLMScan: Causal Scan for LLM Misbehavior Detection
item.description: Despite the success of Large Language Models (LLMs) across various fields, their potential to generate untruthful, biased and harmful responses poses significant risks, particularly in critical applications.

item.title: Mitigating Vanishing Activations in Deep CapsNets Using Channel Pruning
item.description: In addition, the backbone network and capsule layers are pruned with different pruning ratios to reduce the number of inactive capsules and achieve better model accuracy than the unpruned models.

item.title: Dhoroni: Exploring Bengali Climate Change and Environmental Views with a Multi-Perspective News Dataset and Natural Language Processing
item.description: Climate change poses critical challenges globally, disproportionately affecting low-income countries that often lack resources and linguistic representation on the international stage.

item.title: Assessing and improving reliability of neighbor embedding methods: a map-continuity perspective
item.description: LOO-map extends the embedding over a discrete set of input points to the entire input space, enabling a systematic assessment of map continuity, and thus the reliability of the visualizations.

item.title: CoPS: Empowering LLM Agents with Provable Cross-Task Experience Sharing
item.description: In detail, CoPS leverages agents' experiences on previous tasks, selecting distribution-matched experiences via a provable pessimism-based strategy to maximize utility while minimizing risks from distribution shifts.

item.title: MiniPLM: Knowledge Distillation for Pre-Training Language Models
item.description: For effectiveness, MiniPLM leverages the differences between large and small LMs to enhance the difficulty and diversity of the training data, helping student LMs acquire versatile and sophisticated knowledge.

item.title: Science Out of Its Ivory Tower: Improving Accessibility with Reinforcement Learning
item.description: A vast amount of scholarly work is published daily, yet much of it remains inaccessible to the general public due to dense jargon and complex language.
